intro: Ouratea costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican ouratea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory tree or shrub in humid tropical forests. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
